Quiz.QUESTION: Echo (TCP, UDP): Echo service
FTP-data (TCP, SCTP): File Transfer Protocol data transfer
FTP (TCP, UDP, SCTP): File Transfer Protocol (FTP) control connection
SSH-SCP (TCP, UDP, SCTP ):  Secure Shell, secure logins, file transfers (scp, sftp), and port forwarding
Telnet (TCP): Telnet protocol—unencrypted text communications
SMTP (TCP):  Simple Mail Transfer Protocol, used for email routing between mail servers
DNS (TCP, UDP):  Domain Name System name resolver
TFTP (UDP): Trivial File Transfer Protocol
HTTP (TCP, UDP, SCTP  ): Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) uses TCP in versions 1.x and 2. HTTP/3 uses QUIC, a transport protocol on top of UDP.
Kerberos (TCP, UDP): Network authentication system
Iso-tsap (TCP): ISO Transport Service Access Point (TSAP) Class 0 protocol
POP3 (TCP): Post Office Protocol, version 3 (POP3)
Microsoft EPMAP (TCP, UDP): Microsoft EPMAP (End Point Mapper), also known as DCE/RPC Locator service, used to remotely manage services including DHCP server, DNS server, and WINS. Also used by DCOM
NetBIOS-ns (TCP, UDP):  NetBIOS Name Service, used for name registration and resolution
NetBIOS-ssn (TCP, UDP): NetBIOS Session Service
IMAP4 (TCP, UDP):  Internet Message Access Protocol (IMAP), management of electronic mail messages on a server
HP Openview (TCP, UDP): HP data alarm manager
HP Openview (TCP, UDP): HP data alarm manager
HTTP over SSL (TCP, UDP, SCTP): Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS) uses TCP in versions 1.x and 2. HTTP/3 uses QUIC, a transport protocol on top of UDP.
Kerberos (TCP, UDP): Kerberos Change/Set password
SMTP over TLS/SSL, SSM (TCP): Authenticated SMTP over TLS/SSL (SMTPS), URL Rendezvous Directory for SSM (Cisco protocol)
SMTP (TCP): Email message submission
Microsoft DCOM (TCP, UDP): HTTP RPC Ep Map, Remote procedure call over Hypertext Transfer Protocol, often used by Distributed Component Object Model services and Microsoft Exchange Server
LDAP over TLS/SSL (TCP, UDP): Lightweight Directory Access Protocol over TLS/SSL
MS Exchange (TCP): MS Exchange Routing
VMware Server (unofficial): VMware ESXi
FTP over SSL (TCP, UDP): FTPS Protocol (data), FTP over TLS/SSL
FTP over SSL (TCP, UDP): FTPS Protocol (control), FTP over TLS/SSL
IMAP4 over SSL (TCP): Internet Message Access Protocol over TLS/SSL (IMAPS)
POP3 over SSL (TCP, UDP): Post Office Protocol 3 over TLS/SSL

Microsoft RPC (TCP): Microsoft operating systems tend to allocate one or more unsuspected, publicly exposed services (probably DCOM, but who knows) among the first handful of ports immediately above the end of the service port range (1024+).
OpenVPN (TCP, UDP): OpenVPN
WASTE (unofficial): WASTE Encrypted File Sharing Program
Cisco VQP (TCP, UDP): Cisco VLAN Query Protocol (VQP)
Steam (UDP): Valve Steam Client uses port 1725
cPanel (unofficial): cPanel default
radsec, cPanel (TCP, UDP): Secure RADIUS Service (radsec), cPanel default SSL
Oracle DB (TCP, UDP): Oracle database listening for insecure client connections to the listener, replaces port 1521
Oracle DB (TCP, UDP): Oracle database listening for SSL client connections to the listener
Symantec AV (TCP, UDP): Symantec System Center agent (SSC-AGENT)
XBOX Live (TCP, UDP): Xbox LIVE and Games for Windows – Live
MySQL (TCP): MySQL database system
World of Warcraft (TCP, UDP): Some Blizzard games, Unofficial Club Penguin Disney online game for kids
Google Desktop (unofficial): Google Desktop Search
PostgreSQL (TCP): PostgreSQL database system
RFB/VNC Server (TCP, UDP): virtual Network Computing (VNC) Remote Frame Buffer RFB protocol
IRC (TCP): Internet Relay Chat
IRC (TCP): Internet Relay Chat
BitTorrent (unofficial): BitTorrent is part of the full range of ports used most often
BitTorrent (unofficial): BitTorrent is part of the full range of ports used most often
Quicktime (unofficial): QuickTime Streaming Server
Kaspersky AV (TCP): Kaspersky AV Control Center
Kaspersky AV (UDP): Kaspersky AV Control Center
VMware Server (TCP, UDP): VMware Server Management User Interface (insecure Web interface).
PDL (TCP): PDL Data Stream, used for printing to certain network printers[1
BackupExec (unofficial): Webmin, Web-based Unix/Linux system administration tool (default port)
NetBus (unofficial): NetBus remote administration tool (often Trojan horse).
Sub7 (unofficial): Sub7 default
Back Orifice (unofficial): Back Orifice 2000 remote administration tools
